author: David Norman
title: Sunrise, sunset at Machu Picchu
text:
gallery_overlay_open_thumbs|article-gallery-6484488|article-gallery-6484488|0 Image 1 of 1 
David and Rick Norman at the top of Dead Woman's Pass on the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu. Photo: David Norman David and Rick Norman at the top of Dead Woman's Pass on the Inca... Sunrise, sunset at Machu Picchu 1 / 1 gallery_thumbs_close|article-gallery-6484488|article-gallery-6484488|0 gallery_overlay_close|article-gallery-6484488|article-gallery-6484488|0 
Why I went: To hike the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu, to learn about the history and culture of the Inca, and to see the Andes. 
Don’t miss: Seeing the sun rise or set over Machu Picchu. The light at the beginning and end of a day highlights the magic of this magnificent site. 
Don’t bother: Spending more than a day or two in Lima. Cuzco, the Sacred Valley and Machu Picchu have much more to offer. 
Coolest souvenir: Dried gourd carved and painted in the shape of a cuy (guinea pig). 
Worth a splurge: Have lunch at Astrid & Gaston and/or Central Restaurante in Lima. These restaurants were recently rated No. 14 and No. 4 in the world, respectively. 
Wish I’d packed: A small towel to use after washing up from a sweaty and dusty day on the trail. 
Other comments: The Inca Trail, the many ruins along the way, and of course Machu Picchu are testaments to the genius of the Inca. Top Stories
